availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Brownfield (LaRue County, Kentucky, blacksmith)

body.p: LaRue County, Kentucky, blacksmith. Kentucky native. Married Mary Jane Hagan Brownfield in Nelson County, Kentucky, in November 1838. Father of Frank Brownfield, A. Brownfield, Thomas M. Brownfield, G. A. Brownfield, Henry Brownfield, Fielding R. Brownfield, and Charlie B. Brownfield. Blacksmith in LaRue County in 1850. Blacksmith in LaRue County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, LaRue County, Hamiltons, p. 399B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, LaRue County, Hodgenville, p. 331.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 11, p. 532B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Nelson County Marriages, Film 000009668.
"George W. Brownfield (1817-1899)," Find A Grave, Memorial 148711447, accessed September 19, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/148711447.
